Title: An update for nodejs-js-yaml is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3

Notes.Text: An update for nodejs-js-yaml is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3
Notes.Title: Summary

Notes.Text:
This is an implementation of YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language), a human friendly data serialization language. It started as PyYAML port, and was completely rewritten from scratch.  Now it's very fast, and supports the 1.2 spec.

Security Fix(es):

js-yaml is a JavaScript YAML parser and dumper. In js-yaml 4.1.0 and below, it's possible for an attacker to modify the prototype of the result of a parsed yaml document via prototype pollution (__proto__). All users who parse untrusted yaml documents may be impacted. The problem is patched in js-yaml 4.1.1. Users can protect against this kind of attack on the server by using node --disable-proto=delete or deno (in Deno, pollution protection is on by default).(CVE-2025-64718)
Notes.Title: Description

Notes.Text:
An update for nodejs-js-yaml is now available for openEuler-22.03-LTS-SP3.

openEuler Security has rated this update as having a security impact of medium. A Common Vunlnerability Scoring System(CVSS)base score,which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVElink(s) in the References section.
Notes.Title: Topic

Vulnerabilities.Note: js-yaml is a JavaScript YAML parser and dumper. In js-yaml 4.1.0 and below, it's possible for an attacker to modify the prototype of the result of a parsed yaml document via prototype pollution (__proto__). All users who parse untrusted yaml documents may be impacted. The problem is patched in js-yaml 4.1.1. Users can protect against this kind of attack on the server by using node --disable-proto=delete or deno (in Deno, pollution protection is on by default).
